Draw line 4 from point (0.0, 0.525) to point (0.0, 0.0). Define Extrusion With the above-created sketch, define the extrusion with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.1875 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 * Operation: New Body Feature (Create a new solid body) Part 2 Instructions Define Coordinate System Use the following coordinate system parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.375, 0.0, 0.1875] Create Sketch At the XY plane of the new coordinate system, create a sketch with these lines: 1. Draw line 4 from point (0.0, 0.525) to point (0.0, 0.0). Define Extrusion Define the extrusion for the created sketch here: * Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.0975 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.525 * Operation: Join Feature (Add material to the previous body) Part 3 Instructions Define Coordinate System Apply these parameters for coordinate system 3: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.375, 0.225, 0.285] Create Sketch Create a sketch at the XY plane of the new coordinate system with this sequence: 1. Define Extrusion For the previously created sketch, perform the following steps: * Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.09 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.375 * Operation: Join Feature (Add material to the previous body) The resulting model is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom, a flat base, a flat top, and an angled side.
